title: Star Wars 9 trailer: Questions and hints ahead of The Rise Of Skywalker
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The end is nigh in the Star Wars Episode 9: The Rise Of Skywalker trailer, as the last look at the finale to the epic saga dropped overnight.

The battle between the light and the dark forces is taking shape and it looks mighty ominous, as the Resistance seeks to usurp the First Order once and for all.

In emotional scenes that will have us screaming ‘I’m not crying, you are’ for all of eternity, Daisy Ridley‘s Rey teams back up with John Boyega‘s Finn, Kelly Marie Tran‘s Rose and Oscar Isaac‘s Poe Dameron in the JJ Abrams-directed flick.

Advertisement

Advertisement

But while everything is bound to be wrapped in a near little package – so says JJ himself – we’ve just been left with a whole bunch of questions.

Are there hints buried within?

Are we looking too much into things?

Rey and Kylo’s battle on the wreckage of a ship – is it the Death Star?

Where are they fighting? (Picture: Lucasfilm)

Fans have pointed out the battle of Rey and Kylo Ren appeared to riff on the fight between when Anakin Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi in Revenge of the Sith.

While they’re not battling among the flames, the two appeared to meet in the trailer on the wreckage of either a Star Destroyer or the Death Star.

Some believe it’s the former, with a Star Destroyer rising up from the sea.

Who is speaking to Rey?

Show yourself! (Picture: Lucasfilm)

We hear Princess Leia speaking, with Mark Hamill also weighing in on a very emotional scene, but fans are wondering who Rey is looking at as she’s bathed in the blue light.

Some fans have wondered whether she’s looking at the force ghosts including Anakin and Obi-Wan. Others have suggested it’s Yoda reflected in her eye.

Emperor Palpatine makes a comeback

That you, Palpatine? (Picture: Lucasfilm)

‘Long have I waited.’ How ominous.

We hear the Emperor (Iain McDiarmid) say in the trailer: ‘Long have I waited, and now your coming together is your undoing.’

What does it mean and more importantly, how the eff is he back?

Advertisement

Advertisement

He appears to be standing forebodingly over Rey towards the end of the trailer, seemingly propped up.

It could not be Palpatine, we still have two months till we know for sure, especially seeing as he was last seen falling into the arc reactor of the second Death Star in Return Of The Jedi.

If he was killed by Darth Vader, and that is Palpatine in the trailer, has he been cloned?

Whose helmet falls in the opening sequence?

Who owns this? (Picture: Lucasfilm)

As Rey quickly manouevres her way through a still-unknown planet, a helmet falls to the ground.

Whether or not she was holding it or it was simply placed somewhere precariously remains to be seen, however it looks similar to those used by rebel pilots in the original trilogy.

Does this mean Rey is running through the ruins of the Battle of Yavin in 1977?

Some fans have suggested this may also be Endor, the forest planet from Return Of The Jedi.

Is Rose a Resistance leader?

Rose is bossing it (Picture: Lucasfilm)

A maintenance tech who has been rising through the ranks after having her home system destroyed, Rose Tico appeared bold and brave in the trailer, as a returned Lando Calrissian rallied the troops.

What is happening to C-P30?

Don’t go 3PO (Picture: Lucasfilm)

In a heartbreaking moment, the droid, with a collection of wires sticking out the back of his head, proclaimed he was ‘taking one last look…at my friends.’

Cue all the ugly crying.

Advertisement

JJ cannot be killing our beloved gold robot off, right?

One theory suggests he’s either having his memories accessed (because he knows a thing or two about the past nine films) or having them wiped.

The scene feels like a farewell with everyone getting all emosh, but we must remind you poor C-P30 has proclaimed his ending basically any time he senses danger.

He’s an anxious fella. This could just be another one of his false proclamations.

Does Reylo come true?

Are they fighting on the same side? (Picture: Lucasfilm)

Fans have been prophesising a coming together between Rey and Kylo Ren/totally Ben Solo.

But will he jump to the side of the Resistance or will Rey go to the Dark Side?

Rey is heard saying: ‘People keep telling me they know me. No one does.’

But then Kylo, who emerges all wet and with lighsaber drawn before the two engage in battle says: ‘But I do.’

In another shot they destroy a figure wearing Darth Vader’s helmet, seemingly sabering for the same side.

The Rise Of Skywalker is in UK cinemas 19 December.

description: Questions and hints for The Rise Of Skywalker as Star Wars 9 trailer drops.
